remarks: Convergence to zero of the absolute value is equivalent to convergence to zero.  (Contributed by NM, 8-Jul-2008.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 31-Jan-2014.)
statement:
climabs0.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
climabs0.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
climabs0.3 $e |- ( ph -> F e. V ) $.
climabs0.4 $e |- ( ph -> G e. W ) $.
climabs0.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
climabs0.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) = ( abs ` ( F ` k ) ) ) $.
climabs0 $p |- ( ph -> ( F ~~> 0 <-> G ~~> 0 ) ) $.
$d F k $.
$d G k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
